name: Summit Air BAe Avro RJ100 Taxi and Takeoff from Calgary Airport
description:
Summit Air is a Canadian airline headquartered in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories that operates a diverse fleet of ATRs, Dorniers, Twin Otters, Dash 8s, and Avro RJs. Summit flies their Avro RJs into Calgary on mining charters a few times a week, but I've never been lucky enough to catch one! Here we have C-FXRJ, a 21-year-old example of this British airliner taxiing past on Delta and taking off from runway 17L, heading up north to Yellowknife. ATC is included, and thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Summit Air (SUM/SU)
Aircraft: Avro RJ100 (RJ1H)
Flight Number: SU8021
Livery: Standard
Engines: 4x LY LF507-1F 
Registration: C-FXRJ 
Route: Calgary (YYC) - Yellowknife (YZF)
Callsign: SUMMIT 8021
Runway used: 17L
Date filmed: December 20, 2018
Local time: 1000
